timeline.message:
Enable Travis/GitHub Actions Tag Release for the FHIR Repository #145

Also addresses ... Incorporate and Improve test coverage in the
build/site #248

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: what is this? I don't think we have a file at this location.
timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,63 @@
+name: Build and Release
+
+on:
+  push:
+    tags:
+      - '*.*'
+    paths-ignore:
+    - 'docs/**'
+    - '.github/site.yml'

replies.bodyText: avoids this file.  https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/blob/master/.github/workflows/site.yml and site changes on build
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText:
don't you need workflows in the path then?
.github/site.yml -> .github/workflows/site.yml
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: so Build and Release will fire for any tags that have a . in them?
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: Yeah - I read some stuff that you need a wildcard, and '*' was not working with tags.
replies.author: prb112

timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,63 @@
+name: Build and Release
+
+on:
+  push:
+    tags:
+      - '*.*'
+    paths-ignore:
+    - 'docs/**'
+    - '.github/site.yml'
+
+jobs:
+  release-on-push:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        java: [ 'openjdk11' ]
+      fail-fast: false
+    steps:
+    - name: Setup Graphviz environment

replies.bodyText: ah, forgot we're uploading a javadocs jar as part of this release process
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: markdown will squash this formatting, maybe use numbered list?
timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+# 
+The build process supports Travis and GitHub Actions. 
+
+The build executes in three four types
+1 - SNAPSHOT (skips the version change phase)
+2 - EXISTING (ignores the build phase, and is generally local to the user's development machine)
+3 - RELEASE CANDIDATE (automatted)
+4 - RELEASE (automatted)

timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@

+The build process supports Travis and GitHub Actions. 
+
+The build executes in three four types

replies.bodyText: I meant to replace three with four

@@ -0,0 +1,180 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+
+###############################################################################
+# (C) Copyright IBM Corp. 2020
+#
+# SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+###############################################################################
+
+# Store the current directory to reset to
+pushd $(pwd) > /dev/null
+
+# Change to the release directory
+cd "$(dirname ${BASH_SOURCE[0]})"
+
+# Import Scripts
+source "$(dirname '$0')/logging.sh"
+
+# Basic information
+SCRIPT_NAME="$(basename ${BASH_SOURCE[0]})"
+debugging "Script Name is ${SCRIPT_NAME}"
+
+###############################################################################
+# Function Declaration
+
+# set_build_variable - take 3 parameters 
+# the three parameters are 
+function set_build_variable {
+    if [ ! -z "${3}" ] # check to see if the variable is already not empty.
+    then 
+        if [ ! -z "${3}" ]
+        then 
+            outputEnvironment "${1}=${3}"
+        else
+            outputEnvironment "${1}=${2}"
+        fi 
+        debugging "Environment Variable is set [${1}]"
+    else 
+        debugging "Environment Variable is already set [${1}]"
+    fi
+

replies.bodyText: picked up in my next commit.

timeline.message:
Update per PR #145

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Is this file only used for the TRAVIS build then?  Not github actions build and release?
timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,180 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+
+###############################################################################
+# (C) Copyright IBM Corp. 2020
+#
+# SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+###############################################################################
+
+# Store the current directory to reset to
+pushd $(pwd) > /dev/null
+
+# Change to the release directory
+cd "$(dirname ${BASH_SOURCE[0]})"
+
+# Import Scripts
+source "$(dirname '$0')/logging.sh"
+
+# Basic information
+SCRIPT_NAME="$(basename ${BASH_SOURCE[0]})"
+debugging "Script Name is ${SCRIPT_NAME}"
+
+###############################################################################
+# Function Declaration
+
+# set_build_variable - take 3 parameters 
+# the three parameters are 
+function set_build_variable {
+    if [ ! -z "${3}" ] # check to see if the variable is already not empty.
+    then 
+        if [ ! -z "${3}" ]
+        then 
+            outputEnvironment "${1}=${3}"
+        else
+            outputEnvironment "${1}=${2}"
+        fi 
+        debugging "Environment Variable is set [${1}]"
+    else 
+        debugging "Environment Variable is already set [${1}]"
+    fi
+    
+}
+
+# set_build_type - sets the type of the build and the build id
+# 1 - tag 
+# 2 - github_ref
+# 3 - github_sha 
+function set_build_type {
+    if [ "${BUILD_ID}" == *"Integration"* ] || [ -z "${BUILD_ID}" ]
+    then
+        if [ "${1}-" != "---" ]
+        then 
+            # not empty and is tag build
+            if [[ "${1}" == *"RC"* ]]
+            then
+                outputEnvironment "export BUILD_TYPE=\"RELEASE_CANDIDATE\""
+                info "Build_Type is RELEASE_CANDIDATE"
+            else
+                outputEnvironment "export BUILD_TYPE=\"RELEASE\"" 
+                info "Build_Type is RELEASE"
+            fi
+            set_build_variable BUILD_ID "" "${1}"
+        fi
+    else 
+        # SNAPSHOT build
+        set_build_variable BUILD_ID "" "Integration_${2}_${3}"
+        outputEnvironment "export BUILD_TYPE=\"SNAPSHOT\"" 
+    fi
+}
+
+function outputEnvironment { 
+    echo "export ${1}" >> bootstrap.env
+}
+
+###############################################################################
+# Setup Maven Options 
+
+# Not all JVMs support - -XX:MaxPermSize=512m (don't set it)
+# -Xmx2G -Xms1G 
+if [ ! -f ~/.mavenrc ]
+then 
+    echo "MAVEN_OPTS='-Djava.awt.headless=true '" > ~/.mavenrc
+fi
+
+# Threads that are allowed to run
+# which are passed in with BUILD_THREAD
+# we don't want to embed this in maven_opts as certain goals are not thread safe.
+#
+# Examples: 
+#   1C (1Core)
+#   4  (4 Threads)
+THREAD_COUNT=
+if [ ! -z "${BUILD_THREAD}" ]
+then 
+    THREAD_COUNT="-T ${BUILD_THREAD}"
+fi
+
+###############################################################################
+# Setup Git - makes sure there is a gitignore which puts the log in this folder. 
+debugging "Current directory is $(pwd)"
+
+GIT_IGNORE='.gitignore'
+if [ ! -f ${GIT_IGNORE} ]
+then 
+    echo 'logs/' > ${GIT_IGNORE} 
+    echo '**/.cache' >> ${GIT_IGNORE} 
+fi
+
+###############################################################################
+# wipe out existing bootstrap.env files 
+if [ -f bootstrap.env ]
+then 
+    rm -f bootstrap.env
+fi
+
+###############################################################################
+# Setup Default Variables

replies.bodyText: it's for both.  I set it up to execute on both.
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: Never mind, I went back to look at set_build_variable and now I get it.  It only sets the var if the value passed is valued and non-empty.
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: not sure what we gain from this change, is it used anywhere else?
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: it makes the version change very explicit
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: sure - I can change.  it's used to reconcile the versions when we update fhir-tools and fhir-examples. It's much much easier to set-property explicitly
replies.author: prb112

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+
+###############################################################################
+# (C) Copyright IBM Corp. 2020
+#
+# SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+###############################################################################
+
+# This only needs to be non-empty to stop outputting debug messages. 
+DEBUG="false"
+
+# Bintray
+# - Release 
+# - Snapshots
+BINTRAY_REPO=

replies.bodyText: actually - we don't use that anymore.  it's set in release.sh as part of type.  let me clean that up.
replies.author: prb112
